pr_title: Save graph plugin to include a file path parameter #53

timeline.bodyText: More a personal preference but maybe naming it "saveFilePath"? Up to you there
timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: And separate it from graphIdParameter - they should be in distinct blocks for readablitily.
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

replies.bodyText: It also doesn't look like you're adding it to the parameters object?
replies.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.author: antares1470
antares1470

timeline.bodyText: maybe change this to a log instead
timeline.author: antares1470

timeline.bodyText: The second argument here should be a parameter id, not a default value. You can set a default value below using Parameter.setStringValue.
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1

timeline.bodyText: I think I must have confused you so my apologies :). I was ok with the variable name being filePathParameter (makes sense and matches the string you were building with). I was thinking more changing the name set here from "SaveGraphPluginFilePath" to "saveFilePath". It keeps the plugin part out of the name which would be consistent with most plugin parameters.
timeline.author: antares1470

replies.bodyText: Oh right that makes more sense 😆 . I've literally just woken up so that's on me for misunderstanding.
replies.author: formalhaut69

timeline.bodyText: It doesn't matter too much in this case - but generally you want parameter names to be structured as human readable text, ie. "Save File Path".
timeline.author: cygnus-x-1
